The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:
The Flashpoint Energy Partners' Union, MO facility has not had any accidents within the past five years that require reporting.

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:
In the event of an incident, Flashpoint Energy Partners has an emergency action plan that personnel follow to evacuate to a safe location. The propane process can be shut down on an emergency basis and the facility has a plan in the place for evacuations and notification of local emergency response agencies. The facility is a non-responding facility and relies on the Union Fire Protection District to respond to chemical releases. 

Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:
The Flashpoint Energy Partners' Union, MO facility has implemented components of the Program Level 3 RMP and associated PSM program, which ensures improved safety at the facility. Some of these components include employee safety training, management of change procedures, standard operating procedures, incident investigation procedures, and compliance audits. If it is determined that additional safety corrections are required, they will be implemented in a timely and efficient manner.

rtup Safety Review [PSSR] [40 CFR Part 68.77]
Pre-startup safety reviews are conducted after any change to the propane transfer systems procedures, equipment, or technology are implemented. These reviews are conducted to confirm that conditions and procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing the system into operation.

Compliance Audits [40 CFR Part 68.79]
Flashpoint Energy Partners conducts PSM/RMP audits every three (3) years at minimum in order to determine whether the provisions set under the RMP rule are being effectively implemented. Any corrective actions required as a result of these audits will be completed in a safe and timely manner. 

Incident Investigation [40 CFR Part 68.81]
Flashpoint Energy Partners promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could have reasonably resulted in, an unintentional release of propane. These investigations are undertaken within 48 hours of the incident to identify the situation leading to the event, as well as to define any corrective actions implemented to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are maintained onsite for a minimum of five (5) years.

Employee Participation [40 CFR Part 68.83]
The Flashpoint Energy Partners' Union, MO facility has written policies in addition aimed at preventing the release of propane. Each employee must review these policies at least annually. 

Hot Work Permit [40 CFR Part 68.85]
Flashpoint Energy Partners requires issuance of a hot work permit for hot work operations conducted on or near the covered process.

Contractor Safety Program [40 CFR Part 68.87] 
Flashpoint Energy Partners may hire contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and/or construction activities, among other specialized activities, related to the propane transfer system. Prior to selecting a contractor, Flashpoint Energy Partners conducts an evaluation of the potential contractors safety performance initially and annually thereafter. Flashpoint Energy Partners will inform c

int Energy conducts process hazard analyses when necessary to ensure that hazards associated with their propane transfer system are identified and controlled effectively. The methodology used to carry out these analyses is generally a combination of What if and Checklist scenarios, but other methods may be used at the discretion of the process hazard analysis team. Teams are comprised of qualified personnel with expertise in the process and operations of the facility, and studies are re-evaluated every five (5) years at minimum.

Written Operating Procedures [40 CFR Part 68.69]
Detailed written operating procedures are maintained for propane unloading and transfer processes. Step-by-step instructions are given with special safety precautions highlighted. All operations are ceased in the event that any unsafe conditions should arise. Additionally, training is provided for operators and maintenance personnel through third parties. This supplements the existing contractor training programs.

Employee Training [40 CFR Part 68.71]
Flashpoint Energy Partners has a training program in place to ensure all authorized employees and contractors who are working with the propane unloading and loading systems are competent in all applicable operating procedures. 

Mechanical Integrity [40 CFR Part 68.73]
The equipment and piping systems at Flashpoint Energy Partners' Union, MO location are routinely inspected to determine the wall thicknesses at critical points of the piping. This program provides assurance that equipment and piping failure will not occur due to localized corrosion. Records of all inspections are maintained by Flashpoint Energy.

Management of Change [MOC] [40 CFR Part 68.75]
Written procedures are in place to manage potential changes in the propane transfer system procedures, equipment, or technology. Authorized employees whose jobs tasks are affected by a potential modification are promptly informed of and trained on the changes and their implications.

Pre-Sta

This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures, and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements - Risk Management Program pursuant to Title 40 Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR 68) for Flashpoint Energy Partners in Union, Missouri.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:
The Flashpoint Energy Partners' Union, MO facility is a propane unloading and transfer facility, unloading up to four railcars of propane per day to be transported via truck to various end locations. The facility is a non-responding site and has coordinated with the local Union Fire Protection District to respond in the case of accidental release or fire/explosion. They have also coordinated with the local Franklin Country LEPC.

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:
The Flashpoint Energy Partners' Union, MO facility is a propane unloading and transfer facility, unloading up to four railcars of propane per day to be transported via truck to various end locations. The facility includes a vapor header pipe, 36 liquid pipe, compressor, pump skid, and bulkhead for liquid propane transfer. This facility is subject to OSHA PSM rules based on the amount of propane handled onsite, which can exceed the threshold quantity for flammables. Based on the EPA RMP regulation, the Union, MO facility is subject to RMP regulation due to handling and transfer of propane above the threshold quantity of 10,000 lbs. 

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]:

Process Safety Information [40 CFR Part 68.65]
Flashpoint Energy Partners maintains a detailed record of safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment design and details associated with the propane loading and unloading systems.
